channel.title: [HTML Layout] How would I do this?
channel.description: I'm obviously not very good with HTML, So how would I do something like this? I'm looking for a HTML code, I have a background, and everything that I need. But I just don't know how I can do it like this. So that you can click on the image and send you to that page. [IMG]http://i1113.photobucket.com/albums/k503/TheGraphix/HTMLpage.png[/img]

item.title: [HTML Layout] How would I do this?
item.dc:creator: @Skizard Skizard
item.description:
@Skizard wrote:

Use this bit of css code.
It should work and if not let me know I will try to make it work for you.
;D

#buttons{ text-align:center; margin:300px auto; }
I’m sorry you might also need this:

<div id="buttons"> <a href="link here"><img src="img here"/></a> <a href="link here"><img src="img here"/></a> </div>

Read full topic
item.source: [HTML Layout] How would I do this?

item.title: [HTML Layout] How would I do this?
item.dc:creator: @TTSxClan TTSxClan
item.description:
@TTSxClan wrote:

[quote=“RevengePK, post:5, topic:465457”][quote author=TTSxClan link=topic=570684.msg4133881#msg4133881 date=1351470048]

[code]


#left {
float: left;
width: 100px;
}
#right {
margin-left: 100px;
width: 100px;
}





Divine 317


	<div id="right">
		<img src="images/image2.png"></img>
		<h1>Divine Scape</h1>
	</div>
</body>
[/code]

That’s a very simple and straight-forward example, you’ll want to change the CSS for widths to fit your picture dimensions and possibly more space. If you’re still not understand it, I’ll make one for you, just give me the image dimensions.

Well, I tried doing what you said, and this is what a got. http://gyazo.com/ed574cb4650f614ce7cd4bcdb8868a71
I don’t know what I did wrong, I mean, even the images aren’t even showing up. So maybe you could make me one with around 380x190 dimensions?
[/quote]

You need to change the paths to the image in the html.

<img src="path/to/image.jpg"> [/quote]
Yes, Which is exactly what I’m so confused about. Because I did.

Read full topic
item.source: [HTML Layout] How would I do this?

[code]


#left {
float: left;
width: 100px;
}
#right {
margin-left: 100px;
width: 100px;
}





Divine 317


	<div id="right">
		<img src="images/image2.png"></img>
		<h1>Divine Scape</h1>
	</div>
</body>
[/code]

That’s a very simple and straight-forward example, you’ll want to change the CSS for widths to fit your picture dimensions and possibly more space. If you’re still not understand it, I’ll make one for you, just give me the image dimensions.
[/quote]
Well, I tried doing what you said, and this is what a got. http://gyazo.com/ed574cb4650f614ce7cd4bcdb8868a71
I don’t know what I did wrong, I mean, even the images aren’t even showing up. So maybe you could make me one with around 380x190 dimensions?[/quote]

You need to change the paths to the image in the html.

<img src="path/to/image.jpg">
